examples: We travelled across the desert on camelback .

definitions.definition: A flexible water container worn on the back.
examples: An empty camelback is a blessing and a curse: it is easy to carry, but it means you have no water.

definitions.definition: A house with a second storey that does not completely cover the ground floor .
examples: My friend lived in a camelback ; we used to have fun climbing out of the window onto the roof below.

definitions.definition: A railway locomotive that has its cab in the middle as opposed to at the end.
examples: The camelbacks were designed to help with the visibility problems inherent in putting the driver behind the entire engine.

definitions.definition: A sofa or chair whose back has a raised middle part.
examples: He fell back relieved into his favourite camelback with a gin and tonic.

definitions.definition: A type of rubber used in tyre restoration.
examples: We require four million tons of camelback each year.
The camelback rubber produced in this plant is shipped around the world.

definitions.definition: One or more hump -shaped hills on a straight portion of rollercoaster track , designed to lift riders out of their seats and provide a feeling of weightlessness .

secondary_definitions: ( countable ) A flexible water container worn on the back.
( countable ) A house with a second storey that does not completely cover the ground floor .
( countable , rail transport ) A railway locomotive that has its cab in the middle as opposed to at the end.
( countable ) A sofa or chair whose back has a raised middle part.
( uncountable ) A type of rubber used in tyre restoration.
( countable ) One or more hump -shaped hills on a straight portion of rollercoaster track , designed to lift riders out of their seats and provide a feeling of weightlessness .
